title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
ingredients: Freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Cook spaghetti in salted boiling water until al dente, then drain, reserving 1 cup of pasta water.
In a skillet, cook pancetta and garlic over medium heat until crispy (5-7 minutes).
Whisk eggs and cheeses together in a bowl.
Remove skillet from heat, add spaghetti, and quickly pour in the egg mixture, tossing to coat.
Add reserved pasta water as needed to create a creamy sauce.
Season with black pepper and serve immediately.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato based gravy.
instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt and tikka paste for at least 1 hour.
Grill or pan-fry chicken until charred (8-10 minutes), then set aside.
In a large pan, melt butter and sauté onion until golden (5 minutes).
Add crushed tomatoes and garam masala, simmer for 10 minutes.
Stir in cream and cooked chicken, cook for another 5-7 minutes.
Adjust salt and serve with rice or naan.

title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
summary: Classic homemade chocolate chip cookies, soft and chewy.
instructions: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F) and line a baking sheet.
Cream butter and sugars until fluffy.
Beat in egg and vanilla.
Mix flour and baking soda, then combine with wet ingredients.
Fold in chocolate chips.
Scoop dough onto the sheet and bake for 10-12 minutes.
Cool on a rack before serving.

title: Beef Stir-Fry
summary: Quick and easy stir-fry with tender beef and colorful vegetables.
instructions: Heat oil in a wok over high heat.
Stir-fry garlic and ginger for 30 seconds.
Add beef and cook until browned (3-4 minutes).
Toss in vegetables and stir-fry for 3 minutes.
Add soy sauce and oyster sauce, mix well.
Cook for another 2 minutes.
Serve with rice or noodles.

title: Vegetable Curry
summary: A flavorful and aromatic curry with a variety of seasonal vegetables.
instructions: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat.
Sauté onion until soft (about 3-4 minutes).
Add curry paste and cook for 1 minute.
Stir in coconut milk and bring to a simmer.
Add potato, carrot, and cauliflower, then cook for 15-20 minutes until tender.
Season with salt to taste.
Serve with rice or flatbread.

title: Pancakes
summary: Fluffy and golden pancakes, perfect for breakfast or brunch.
instructions: Whisk flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a bowl.
In another bowl, mix egg, milk, and melted butter.
Combine wet and dry ingredients until just mixed.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat.
Pour batter to form pancakes and cook until bubbles form (2-3 minutes per side).
Serve with maple syrup.

title: Salmon with Lemon and Dill
summary: Baked salmon fillets with a refreshing lemon and dill sauce.
instructions: Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F).
Mix olive oil, lemon juice, zest, garlic, dill, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
Place salmon fillets in a baking dish and brush with the mixture.
Bake for 12-15 minutes until salmon flakes easily with a fork.
Serve with a lemon wedge.

title: Mushroom Risotto
summary: Creamy and comforting risotto with earthy mushrooms.
instructions: Heat olive oil and 1 tbsp butter in a large pan over medium heat.
Sauté onion until soft (about 3-4 minutes), then add mushrooms and cook until browned.
Stir in Arborio rice and toast for 1-2 minutes.
Gradually add warm vegetable stock, one ladle at a time, stirring until absorbed (about 20 minutes).
Stir in remaining butter and Parmesan cheese.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot.

title: Guacamole
summary: A creamy and flavorful avocado dip, perfect with tortilla chips.
instructions: Scoop avocado flesh into a bowl and mash with a fork.
Add diced tomato, chopped onion, lime juice, cilantro, and jalapeño (if using).
Mix until well combined.
Season with salt to taste.
Serve with tortilla chips.

title: French Onion Soup
summary: A rich and savory soup with caramelized onions and melted cheese.
instructions: Melt butter in a pot over medium heat.
Add onions and sugar, cook until caramelized (20-25 minutes).
Stir in flour and cook for 1 minute.
Pour in beef broth and simmer for 15 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Toast baguette slices, top with grated Gruyère cheese, and broil until melted.
Ladle soup into bowls and top with cheesy bread.
